elements.title: Project EV
elements.description: smart AC / DC EV chargers both domestic and industrial, has partnered with software platform [Electric Miles](https://www.electricmiles.io/) to deploy a network of chargers providing grid flexibility

elements.title: Electric Miles
elements.description: Electric Miles connects EV charging with batteries to provide smart tariffs and grid flexibility. Has partnered with [Project EV](https://www.projectev.co.uk/) to implement a network of chargers, in the News [Dec 2021](https://www.energylivenews.com/2021/12/10/new-partnership-eyes-100k-ev-smart-charge-points/)

elements.title: BCG report - Winning the Battle in the EV Charging Ecosystem
elements.description: As electric vehicle sales take off, demand for public charging will explode. Providers can pursue seven strategic plays in this nascent but fast-moving market.

elements.title: PWC report - Powering ahead!
elements.description: Making sense of business models in electric vehicle charging. PDF [here](https://www.pwc.co.uk/power-utilities/assets/powering-ahead-ev-charging-infrastructure.pdf)

elements.title: Knight Frank report - E-mobility is the future. But what does that mean for real estate?
elements.description: The  Energy & Sustainability team explores how the growth of electric vehicles will impact real estate and what opportunities exist for landlords, developers and occupiers. The e-mobility report is [here](https://knightfrank.foleon.com/pitch/e-mobility/introduction/)

elements.title: Bonnet electric
elements.description: mobile app with a map for EV charging and a monthly fee structure that includes a certain amount of kwh

elements.title: Cenex
elements.description: Cenex was established as the UK’s first Centre of Excellence for Low Carbon and Fuel Cell technologies in 2005. Cenex focuses on low emission transport & associated energy infrastructure and operates as an independent, not-for-profit research technology organisation (RTO)

elements.title: Diode
elements.description: Diode specialises in building electric vehicle implementation plans, matching them to the right infrastructure and securing the best deal.

elements.title: Wallbox
elements.description: Barcelona based Wallbox is a smart charging company on a mission to liberate the world from fossil fuels. Raised €33M in Feb 2021, from [Techcrunch](https://www.finsmes.com/2021/02/wallbox-raises-e33m-in-funding.html)

elements.title: Instavolt
elements.description: Backed by a £12m equity investment by private equity firm Zouk Capital, Instavolt is on track to be the largest owner-operator of rapid DC charging stations in the UK .

elements.title: pod point
elements.description: Pod point, formed in 2009, have manufactured and sold over 96,000 charging points across the UK and Norway. [In the news, May 21](https://www.edie.net/news/8/In-action--Exploring-Skanska-electric-vehicle-charging-retrofit/): Skanska worked with EDF-owned chargepoint provider Pod Point to install EV chargers at its Hertfordshire office in Maple Cross.

elements.title: eo charging
elements.description: ev charging. Found on [uktn post](https://www.uktech.news/news/these-uk-battery-tech-ev-charging-startups-are-accelerating-shift-to-cleaner-energy-future-in-2021-20210208): The most lit battery tech startups in UK to follow in 2021, feb 21

elements.title: Volta
elements.description: developer of a network of electric vehicle charging stations that monetize using advertising. Raised $125M in Feb 2021, from [Techcrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2021/01/19/ad-supported-ev-charging-network-developer-volta-raises-125-million/)

elements.title: McKinsey - How charging in buildings can power up the electric-vehicle industry
elements.description: More than 50 million electric vehicles could be sharing roads in the next five years. Updating charging infrastructure is key to scaling the industry. Jan 2021

elements.title: Connected Kerb
elements.description: Our smart cities platform integrates both power and data at kerbside to support electric and autonomous vehicles, and the application of advanced IoT technologies.

elements.title: V2G uk trial
elements.description: geo are leading a BEIS funded consortium  that’s enabling domestic demand-side-response through our Hybrid Home in 24 UK homes.

elements.title: Dreev
elements.description: EV Smart charging V2G platform. Dreev solution relies on Nuvve technology that has already been deployed and validated on 5 continents. Dreev is a creation of both San Diego based [Nuvve](https://nuvve.com/) and EDF Pulse Expansion.

elements.title: Vehicle-to-grid: Where’s the smart money?
elements.description: a comprehensive overview of V2G and V1G technologies and regulations. before regulatory changes come into effect, much of the potential value is from behind-the-meter optimisation

elements.title: EV energy
elements.description: Our smart platform manages EV charging, automatically optimizing for a greener, cheaper charge.

elements.title: EV footprint depends on the grid
elements.description: EV footprint depends on the grid producing the li-ion battery

elements.title: McKinsey - Charging electric-vehicle fleets: How to seize the emerging opportunity
elements.description: 2020 article - By 2030, the US market for energy-optimization services to support the charging of electric-vehicle fleets could be worth $15 billion per year. Here is how companies can capture the opportunity.
